body.name: LEGEND COOKWARE | Cast Iron Skillet with Lid | Large 12” Frying Pan with Glass Lid & Silicone Handle for Oven, Induction, Cooking, Pizza, Sautéing & Grilling
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Sunday, February 18 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 5 hrs 41 mins
features: THE PAN. THE MYTH. THE LEGEND – Famous for lifelong durability and workhorse versatility, Legend cast iron combines a rich heritage with modern cooking needs. Cast from solid, pure, premium steel and iron, this healthy nonstick skillet is THE master of heat distribution.

LONGER HANDLE FOR EASIER LIFTING – 10-inch skillet features our extra-long handle design and includes a heat-resistant holder + tempered glass lid. Now you can master all your favorite dishes and enjoy easier handling when cooking and serving.

IMPROVES WITH EVERY USE – The more you cook, the better it performs. Your Legend skillet arrives with a foundational seasoning of 100% vegetable oil (no synthetics or chemicals). As you build up your own seasoning, you write your story into a pan that’s worth passing down.

GIVE THE GIFT OF LOVE – For the chef who swears by cast iron; for the home cook who’s discovered its allure; for the sourdough baker; for the guy with a penchant for cooking; for the granny who appreciates the high-quality of yesteryear. Give ‘em the gift of a Legend.

BEYOND-LEGENDARY QUALITY – Legend Cast Iron pots and pans are made to last a lifetime and then some. Nothing beats cast iron’s durability; just try putting a dent in this! When our superior quality craftsmanship partners with your culinary passions, you can expect great things.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2021
reviews.reviewText: This iron skillet is quite big. It has amazing heat distribution that ensures your food is cooked done and evenly. Its easy to clean because its nonstick. Its versatility to be used for stove top, oven or even open fire is one of its best qualities. Its made heavy duty, a little bit on the heavy side but well worth the money. It even comes with a silicone handle sleeve to prevent accidentally burning your hands. Great value.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My favorite skillet
reviews.reviewText: I’ve left a 5 star review before, the skillet itself is the best. I bought a second set for my mother in law who was visiting as a gift, when she opened it when she flew back home, the silicone handle was missing. I contacted the seller and I was very happy that they resolved the issue. Other than that 5 stars.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2023
reviews.reviewText: After a slow start (which, customer service totally went above & beyond) to rectify, I said that I would re-evaluate once it's been used. I have used it quite a number of times and it's held up quite well. I washed and seasoned it for best results. Had some eggs stick but the trick to cast iron is continued use and seasoning which I've done. I am more than confident this piece will stay in constant rotation in my kitchen. I must say, it is NEVER far away when I cook. I would definitely purchase this brand again!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Skillet cooks evenly
reviews.reviewText: I've avoided purchasing cast iron pans in the past, as I was concerned that my natural habit of grabbing the handle while stirring would result in a bad burn. But the silicon handle cover reduces that risk. Having seasoned the Legend skillet 5 times, I've used it twice since then, the first time with fish. I also like the glass lid with silicon knob, and generally everything about this pan, except for the rough texture of the interior surface. Though well coated with oil, a lot of food residue stuck to the pan during its first use. I tried it again today for a mushroom & onion sauce, and was happy with the way it held heat for a gentle simmer, and cooked evenly. No problem cleaning it up afterward. I assume that with each use, the patina will build, and the the surface will become smoother. Looking forward to many more uses of this nice-looking skillet.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great Cast iron with a cover and only a couple minor flaws.
reviews.reviewText: I love this cast iron pan and use it regularly. As with most cast iron when properly seasoned it's relatively nonstick and can be scrubbed clean (I recommend a piece of chainmail) with some hot water and some vigorous scrubbing without the use of soap. Do not use soap on cast iron, it messes with the seasoning. On my pan however I'm not sure if it's uniformly thick all around because the seasoning in the middle keeps cooking off under seasoning heat while the edges are relatively unheated. Sure the edges will heat up (the handle and outer grip take awhile to heat up) but for after cooking stovetop seasoning it's kind of uneven. For all around seasoning I have to wipe it all over with grease or something and stick it in the oven for a few hours otherwise a center splotch of the pan isn't as seasoned. It's not a huge deal, as it's still relatively cast irony. I still love the pan more than a lot of my other pans though. Be sure to clean the inner edges of the lid well as they can accumulate grease and other detritus by the seam that a few swipes with a cleaning pad will easily miss.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I love it all my expectations was met.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Half the price of Lodge
reviews.reviewText: We LOVE cast iron pans in our house. They're our goto pans, because they're so versatile. We cook almost everything in them. My husband makes the absolute best steaks in the cast iron. He reverse sears them by putting them in the oven at a low temperature, until they reach the desired temperature. Once they're the right temperature, he sears them for 2 minutes on each side. They're so tender you can literally slice through them with a butter knife. Dang, my mouth is watering just thinking about it. I use it for all the rest of the cooking. I especially like using it instead of my Dutch oven, because the heat is more evenly distributed. Two months ago, I purchased a Legend pizza pan and it's the best pizza pan I've ever had. It's holding up great and seasoning up nicely. Not only is their cast iron made with high quality steel and iron, but it's half the price of the Lodge brand. I chose this pan because I needed one with a tempered glass lid. My other pans either didn't have a lid or the lid was cast iron. This lid is made with good quality glass and it's very easy to clean. The extra long handle with the silicone sleeve makes it much easier to get the pan in and out of the oven. It comes pre-seasoned with vegetable oil, which is extremely important and essential. When I was looking at pans some were pre-seasoned, but with synthetic products that are full of chemicals. Who wants to cook their food in a pan that's basically seasoned with poison. Yuk! I'm very impressed with the quality and durability of the Legend brand of cast iron and will definitely be purchasing more.

reviews.reviewerName: Leobardo Ulises Garibay MendozaLeobardo Ulises Garibay Mendoza
reviews.reviewText: Seguí todas las indicaciones previas a su uso, y resultó esto. Me pesa muchísimo haber gastado mi dinero en este pésimo producto. Cero de anti adherencia. Eviten el mal gasto de su dinero.
After doing a couple more seasons ive started using it more. Educating myself on the art of cast iron cooking.Like the lid. Think I'll get some smaller pans for the versatility.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cast iron with a lid and handle
reviews.reviewText: Make sure to cure the pan following the instructions or your eggs will stick
